result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel L Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs on Ct. 2.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

To pay the costs of action on Ct. 3.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment as directed by probation agent.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Jail time applies to Ct. 2. Jail time is stayed. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Huber release granted. Credit for time served.

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Defendant Gabriel L Perez in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant makes statement.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence.

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Defendant Gabriel L Perez in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Court orders PSI in all files pending for defendant.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 12-30-2015 09:45 am

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 2 & 3.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 2 & 3. Court dismisses Ct. 1 but reads in for sentencing purposes. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond is no longer in effect.
State Discovery Demand
Defense waives reading of Information, stands mute and asks court to enter not guilty plea to all counts. Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf to all counts. Bond remains as is.
Defense Discovery Demand

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Testimony taken from Officer Wiegand, sworn. State Exh. 1 - photo of victim. Offered and received. Cross. Def. Exh. 2 - Copy of report by Officer Jennerjohn. Offered and received. Redirect. Recross.  Court finds probable cause that felony was committed and probable cause that defendant committed that felony and binds over for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
from ADA Korb asking to reschedule 10/22/14 prelim. as Officer Wiegand is not available. Court reschedules.
Preliminary hearing on December 10, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 22, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Set for prelim. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defendant is in the process of retaining Atty Rick Meier, needs a couple more weeks to get money together for retainer fee. State has no objection to adjournment.  Bond remain in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant appears on his own.

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears at 11:06 AM, advises he went to probation office when he was released from jail this morning. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews events in file, cancels bench warrant previously ordered.     Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD representation, requests time to retain an attorney. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Gabriel L Perez not in court.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Dep. Bemmann advises defendant left the jail at 9:56 AM this morning, didn't appear for court. State requests bench warrant for non appearance. Court orders bench warrant.
Defendant was fingerprinted 5/27/14 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 2/20/15)
No contact direct or indirect with A.P.

Defendant Gabriel L Perez appears by video conference.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.
